answers.answer: Have you elevated your feet on pillows laying down?
Yes ma'am I have. It didn't work at all.
I have a really bad problem with swelling too. My doctor tells me to put my feet up, drink lots of water, and relax. Are you feeling dizzy, shaky, racing heart, or anything weird like that?

Alright I'll try that and the only weird thing that I have happen to me is sometimes when I lay down I'll get short of breath my heart rate feels like it slows down significantly and my heart literally feels like it's going to beat out of my chest..... it doesn't happen all the time and only lasts for a couple seconds

Do a little test and press firmly on the inside of your "heel" between the base of your ankle and the base of your heel. It should be approximately 1/3 of the way towards the heel, closer to the ankle bone in a direct line. As long as you can feel your pulse (check it just like you would on your neck or wrist), you should be fine and it's probably just water weight.

I only ask because those things I listed can be a sign of high blood pressure, which can also be a sign of preeclampsia. Make sure to watch for any additional symptoms with the swelling. And don't hesitate to call your doctor if you think you may be at risk for either of those things.

question: My ankles are swollen pretty bad and it just now started doing it a couple of days ago. The problem is that my left ankle is 2 1/2 to 3 Times bigger than it normally is. Its been like this all day and the swelling hasn't gone down any at all. Should I be worried or is this normal?
title: Swelling.
